de.susebox.jtopas

Class StringSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.susebox.jtopas.StringSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CharSequenceTokenizerSource, TokenizerSource, java.lang.CharSequence

    public class StringSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements CharSequenceTokenizerSource
    Implementation of the TokenizerSource and its extension CharSequenceTokenizerSource for strings. It is a shortcut for: 
       String           myData = "...";
   TokenizerSource  source = new ReaderSource(new StringReader(myData));
    The class also provides a faster access to the data in a string through the methods of the CharSequence interface. Since this interface was only introduced with Java 1.4, this class can only be used with 1.4 or higher Java versions.
    Author:
    Heiko Blau
    See Also:
    TokenizerSource, CharSequenceTokenizerSource, CharArraySource

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public int read(char[] cbuf,
                int offset,
                int maxChars)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This method copies the available data into the given buffer according to the given offset and maximum character count. See TokenizerSource.read(char[], int, int) for details.
        Specified by:
        read in interface TokenizerSource
        Parameters:
        cbuf - buffer to receive data
        offset - position from where the data should be inserted in cbuf
        maxChars - maximum number of characters to be read into cbuf
        Returns:
        actually read characters or -1 on an end-of-file condition
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - anything that could happen during read, most likely IOException
